Located right outside of Dong Ha's Co.Op Mart, Mr. Trum is easy to get to! The little shop has an array of wooden chairs and tables for customers to eat at, although it's just as easy to order take-away. The lady working Mr. Trum is nice and makes some light small talk and is pretty quick, too! I ordered a Thai milk tea with pearls to-go. The drink was pretty standard sweet and the pearls have been standard compared to other milk tea shops in Dong Ha. The pricing was on the lower end, a few 1000 VND lower. I think if I ever am craving some milk tea after shopping, I'll know where to stop by!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/com-tam-s.user_comment: Came here for takeaway because I was looking for a com tam place. It is not too far from the center of town, so easy to get to if you need something! The lady running the food stall is quick and accommodating. I get takeaway boxes and she fills the bottom with a lot of broken rice and then you get your share of toppings. You can choose from your grilled pork chops, egg cake, meat balls, and fried tofu squares. The rice is also topped off with some cooked bean sprouts and fried pork rinds. You get a little bag of fish sauce with your takeaway box and you're off! For 30K, this is really a lot of food. So, if you're looking for some home cooking and at an affordable price, would recommend stopping by this shop!

C√≥ d·ªãp gh√© ƒê√¥ng H√† m√¨nh s·∫Ω gh√© l·∫°i. Bu·ªïi t·ªëi gh√© ƒë√¢y ch·∫Øc kh√° s√¢u ƒë√≠p lu√¥n.
·ªû ƒë√¢y th√≠ch h·ª£p cho m·∫•y b·∫°n h·∫πn h√≤, t·ª• t·∫≠p b·∫°n b√® t√¨m ch·ªó y√™n tƒ©nh.

Visited here on a quiet Thursday evening during what I assume is a typical dinner time since it was largely empty (good for me, though!). The night was nice and cool, leaving the open-air cafe a comfortable place to sit in. I walked past the chairs in the area facing the street and made my way into the interior of the cafe, which is so much cuter and more cozy to be in! There are yellow industrial bulbs hanging around the cafe, giving it a warm, amber glow that sets a very cool evening feel to chat with friends. The seating indoors has two sets of padded couches you can sit down at and then a few larger wooden tables with accompanying chairs that looked nice, but not as nice to sit in. In the back corner is the coffee bar.

With some soothing jazz covers of hit singles playing in the background, I was able to dig into a book on my Kindle for a good hour (although, the lighting makes it hard to read a traditional book in the evening!). Comfortable place to read, that's for sure!

The Vietnamese iced coffee ran for 20K and was pretty decent. I'll have to come back sometime soon to soak up the wonderful ambiance, well-thought out interior decoration and swanky tunes! Would recommend!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/pho-bo-ha.user_titlec: Everything you want & a little more!
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/pho-bo-ha.user_comment: Although a bit further from the center of town, this pho shop is worth the extra few minutes you'd have to travel to get here! I went to this shop late last year and looks like they recently renovated it. The entire interior has been redone and it looks great -- new tiles, freshly painted walls with a few accoutrements here and there. Notably, the pho corner has also moved. For 25K, you get your standard bowl of pho bo tai. The shop is well stocked in your pickled garlic and onions, too! I don't always see stalks of green onions in my pho, but I got two in this bowl! I think what helps separate this shop from others is its cleanliness. The interior is clean like your own home -- it's definitely a nice touch! Would recommend!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/quan-an-d.user_comment:
I've driven past this place a few times and have been meaning to stop by! Came in around 6 p.m. tonight and the place was already fairly crowded. The clanging of woks on the stove is the first thing you hear, followed by the... wholesome smell of cooking oil! You see all the food being prepared right in front of you, and looking by how busy the place was, I imagine the food is being made around the clock!

I made my order up front and took a seat and the food was brought out in a few minutes. I ordered the fried rice and grilled pork chop dish. The rice is a golden yellow with bits of eggs scattered round, and the pork chop was delectably tender and juicy. Topped with a smattering of sauteed green onions (lemon grass?), the pork chop was definitely the highlight of the dish. With a few slices of cucumber on the side and a bowl of chicken broth to wash things down, the meal comes to 30K and is utterly satisfying! The plate of rice seemed overwhelming at first, but a spoonful of it here and there with a bite of pork meant quick work to finish the meal.

Would definitely recommend visiting for a meal and I hope to return soon to try out their other dishes!

Came here on a chilly afternoon for something warm to eat. Bowl of pho comes out pretty quickly and is everything you expect. You'll get your side of greens, bean sprouts and lime. Unfortunately, no pickled garlic or onions in sight! The beef was a little chewier this time around, but it could vary from day to day, or the beef itself. The bowl was 30K, which runs about a little above average from other places I've seen. But, the shop is located close to the center of town so it is a convenient place to stop by if you want something to eat, and there are some nice cafes in very short walking distance if you want somewhere to relax after a meal.

I love going to Tik Tik Talk! It's a small corner of a larger hotel, decorated with an array of wooden tables and chairs outside. The interior is on the smaller size, but makes things feel more intimate and personal. There are tall glass windows for coffee-goers to view traffic going by while staying away from the noise of outside. I like the interior because the design is cohesive and suits well to a modern looking cafe. There's a little barista bar stand in one corner and cushioned long bench seating on one wall. There's bar seating in front of that glass window and then small tables filling the rest of the cafe. The cafe is nice to go to on a weekday afternoon where it's relatively empty and you get to have the place to yourself and do work (as I did). Otherwise, the cafe seems to pick up at typical peak hours, especially the weekend! Looks like you can get the most out of the cafe depending on when you decide to go! Would definitely recommend and plan on coming back to get work done. 

Oh, and coffee isn't bad either!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/doha-cafe.user_comment:
Such a pleasant place for friends meeting or couple dating!

Dong Ha is a small and quiet city, so it isn't easy to find a place that combing all good in one. Classic environment, rich quality of Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk, and more importantly, price range is surprisingly cheap! Only 15,000 VND for a cup of Vietnamese coffee. I was so satisfied dropping by when I saw lots of people came here. And now I know I was right!

user_CmtOfCmt.nameUserLikeText: B√¥ng XuXi, Ch√¢u ƒê√†o Ho√†ng C·∫©m, Tuan Le

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/doha-cafe.user_comment: I came here at night recently and sat on the second floor balcony. The cafe keeps a more-than-dim lit atmosphere with soft music playing in the background and the sound of motorbikes to add ambience. There's some outdoor seating at ground level and then quite a few tables indoors. Up the narrow and steep stairs is just room for two or so tables on the balcony and a cozy floor seating area in the center of upstairs. It looked like a cute place to spend time with loved ones or enjoy a more intimate conversation, as a slew of couples and families did the evening I visited. The coffee was nice and rich, going for 15K for an iced milk coffee. It's a nice place to enjoy the night and I've driven past during the daytime seeing it just as busy. I'm sure it's a popular location, with it being right next to the AH1 and not too far from the center of town! If you have any size group of friends, check it out!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/lo-banh-m.user_comment: I've been to this bakery more times than I can count and absolutely love it! The bakery is right down the street from where I work, so it's super convenient to stop by for some baked goods or a sandwich on the go. Although the shop is smaller, they have all you need -- donuts and muffins to sausage and pork floss covered bread and doughnut-battered sausage on a skewer. And, of course, they make you a Vietnamese baguette sandwich, too! The cheapest item is the doughnut at 3K (I think) and then the most expensive is a baguette sandwich at 10K. Everything else falls in between last time I checked. Grab a sandwich for a quick breakfast or late night snack or buy a handful of baked goods to save for later. On top of the good food at good prices is the family that runs the shop! The bakery is named after their son and the husband and wife can usually be seen running the place. The wife always has a smile on her face when you greet her at the baked goods, so it just makes buying stuff here all the sweeter. Definitely recommend to passerbys and especially students going to the college!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/tra-sua-p.user_comment: Tra Sua PP is a small pocket near a central roundabout of Dong Ha, right next to the railroad tracks that run past the Dong Ha Market and supermarket. Located as one of those streetside eateries,  most of its seating are the iconic small plastic red tables and stools with maybe one or two tables inside the shack that is PP. With a small bar of syrups and snack foods, PP gives you enough of what you may want for an evening to chat with friends. On a colder Spring evening in Dong Ha, though, I opted for takeaway. A combination topping milk tea runs for 15K and comes with some popping boba and pudding and fruit jelly. The drink was fine but there was quite a bit of ice in it! At a pretty standard price and a good location, I think I might stop by again if I just want something quick to take home!

I've been here twice now for takeaway che pickups and they'e been pretty good on both occasions! I opt for the che thai (15K) and I've gotten a side of pudding once and a coconut milk soft tofu (12K) the other. The che thai is coconut milked filled with an array of jack fruit strips, puddings, coconut jelly and a piece of longan. As a mix, it's pretty refreshing and sweet! I've only had it on cold days thus far, so I imagine it's even better during the warmer season. I really liked their pudding and coconut milk tofu, too! Maybe more than the che thai. The little shop is easy to get to and located near the center of town, so if you're ever in need of a fix, you won't be too far off!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/banh-mi-h.user_titlec: One of my favorite breakfast spots!
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/banh-mi-h.user_comment: I love coming here when I'm craving some breakfast food! I usually get the banh my pa te - op la plate, which runs for 28K. The plate comes with two small French baguettes, two eggs, two slices of pa te, a few cucumbers and handful of pork floss all in sauce and topped with a bit of parsley and a side of chili paste. It's a lot for one plate of food, but absolutely satisfying and filling. The shop is usually busy in the morning with a mix of people dining in and some grabbing sandwiches to go, making it a fun environment to eat in as you watch life go by. I would definitely recommend going here for a hearty meal to start your day!

MyA's Coffee has a great location, being at the corner in front of the huge cultural building in Dong Ha. If you're sitting on the second floor near one of the cafe's huge glass windows, you'll have a good view of whatever activity is going on down below, whether it be the passing of traffic or people hanging around the wide open square. The interior of the cafe is just as great as the view, erring on the minimalist side with neutral colors being a strong vibe. The cafe is neatly organized with well-thought-out placing of decorations and furnishings. A cup of hot coffee with condensed milk ran me 21K, a bit pricey comparably, but it was at least a rich, nutty coffee. The music was a little loud for my taste, but it would be great for the gathering of friends to enjoy playful conversation or a reunion! Would recommend the cafe to anyone looking for another spot to hang out at in Dong Ha!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/com-binh-.user_titlec: The fried chicken here is fantastic!
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/com-binh-.user_comment: I've been here twice now for lunch and it's a pretty great place for your run-of-the-mill com binh dans. The first time really got me because of the big piece of fried chicken they put on my dish. It was beautifully crispy yet not too oily. The meat was cooked perfectly well and flavorful with good batter. On top of the delectable piece of fried chicken, the little binh dan place gives you a lot of other toppings to choose from. They also let you choose from 15K or 20K worth of rice, so you can have a filling lunch or a really filling lunch. The older auntie and uncle that run the place are great and I'll definitely be back!

Stay Cafe is a bit off the main road, a stand-alone and roomy place to hang out. There's a nice patio out front and cute first floor interior (I didn't check out the second floor). A lot of space to sit without anyone too close by if you don't want to be near people. The seats are comfy and the colors are nice. I ordered a Peach Tea for 25K which came in a cute jar with a house coaster as well. Overall, I think it's a nice place to spend time catching up with friends with lots of room to make your meetings nice and private or large and rowdy!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/napoli-ca.user_comment:
I dipped into Napoli around half past six, a small group of men chatting it up in the front corner of the cafe. A few low wooden tables and chairs sit outside of Napoli, the "normal" seated, colorfully woven chairs with arm rests being inside. The interior is an unsubtle mixture of idyllic small town mural painting and large coffee-themed printouts. In the back likes a small boxed-in coffee bar, drink making accouterments unseen but easily heard.

The lady serving me was friendly and quick to help, taking my order and bringing it out promptly with a side glass of tea, which was never left unfilled. While I was there, a TV was being installed and connected to the internet, so they were testing out music videos and other things. The noise was sporadic at best, but it was fairly quiet while I was there. The coffee was tall and viscously sweet concoction. The indoor of Napoli was brightly lit -- good for reading -- but maybe not as pleasant for enjoying a nice evening to chat since it feels like you're in a supermarket. 

Overall, Napoli's not a bad place to visit. Coffee's good. Maybe it's quiet. And it feels cozy enough if there aren't too many other customers there!

Rich's is on the corner of Hung Vuong and Ngo Quyen, making it not too far off from the center of town and thus easily accessible. Better yet, the small stand is roadside so you can make picking up some snacks for home even easier. Or, you can take a seat on the sidewalk with some of the stools and tables they have set up. Rich's had a few customers when I stopped by, and I've seen it busy on a few nights I've driven by. I ordered a chocolate milk tea and it came with a slice of pudding. Pretty standard drink at an all right price! If I ever need a quick fix, I'll know this place is easy to reach!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/moon-coff.user_titlec: Nice Place to Pass the Time
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/moon-coff.user_comment: Moon Coffee is an open-air two-story (ish) cafe with some running water through the interior. Moderately lit at night, Moon is a nice place to catch up over a drink with a friend or just spend some time chatting about the going-ons of your life. I really liked the interior and felt the vibe of Moon was very well done. The second story is a bit small and requires walking up some narrow and steep stairs, but if you can grab a table up there with a friend or two, you'll get to enjoy some more privacy and watch some traffic pass by. I'll have to go back in the daytime sometime to see what it's like!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/quan-kiwi.user_titlec: A moment's reprieve, milk tea included
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/quan-kiwi.user_comment:
Kiwi is pretty close to the center of town, a short drive down Nguyen Trai from Hung Vuong. It has a pretty modest storefront and interior. A little cart is pushed out front for all the drink concoctions, and a kitchen lines the right wall of Kiwi. It's a fairly open space with a little over a dozen wooden/metal tables with red and yellow plastic stools around.

I dipped in for the second time close to 6 p.m. and there were just two other high schoolers enjoying a snack. I took a seat in a back corner and made my order -- Thai green milk tea -- and started reading. To my pleasant surprise -- no loud music! No music at all, actually. I'm not sure if they turn it on later, but for the hour I was there -- just the crackle of oil overheard from the "kitchen". The milk tea was just right in sweetness, where I see more than a few milk tea shops oversweetening their drinks. The Thai tea came with exactly four pieces of jelly -- one pink, one green, one yellow and one chocolate brown. It was good and just 15K!

Aesthetics aside, I really liked the place for being quiet, at least for the moment. A couple rolled in halfway during my hour and a group of younger students came in just as I left. So, if you're going here to read -- 6 p.m. is a good time! Hanging out with friends? Perhaps anytime before or after. Hopefully I can come back and try the food!

Nova is located on a quiet corner of Dong Ha, making it a nice place to come and enjoy some snacks and drinks. Fitting about 15 people max inside and maybe 10 or so others outside, Nova is definitely on the smaller size, but I think it makes up for it with hand-painted murals indoors and some kitschy decor. Better yet, the indoors portion of Nova feels a lot more homey because you have to take off your shoes and then proceed to some floor seating on some satin-esque maroon cushions. The little tables fit four, making Nova a great place to just spend some time with close friends. I ordered a milk tea with toppings for 15K and pretty good! I'll definitely be back for a quick drink and a quiet, relaxing place to read. Nova is your little space that feels like home away from home!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/banh-mi-1.user_comment: Banh My 197, titled according to what it sells and the corresponding street number, is a little white food cart on the corner of the road. It stands out because the coat of white paint on the cart is stark contrast to the worn and mossed over concrete tiles of the sidewalk. A lovely lady runs the cart and is quick to help you -- right when I pulled up on the side of the road, she stood up and asked what I wanted as she walked to the cart. I ordered two pate egg sandwiches and she made them promptly. She spread some chili, pate and soy sauce in the bread and filled it with some cucumbers and leafy herbs while the eggs were frying. Once the eggs finished, she firmly placed them inside, wrapped the sandwiches in some recycled paper and bagged it all. 10K a sandwich seems the standard price, so can't complain there! Sandwiches were everything I expected, too! If you need something quick and comes with a smile -- be sure to stop by here!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/hem-cafe.user_comment: Hem Coffee is a bit ways down Hung Vuong, but it's a pretty popular cafe for locals. Located on a not-very-busy corner of Dong Ha, Hem is usually packed during peak hours, like weekend mornings. The cafe is completely open with most seats "outside" of the building. There are a few seats inside where the bar area is, but a lot of the wooden tables and chairs are under a corrugated tin roof. The cafe is minimal on decor, but that's important! The cafe seems like the spot to meet for a lot of local men, filling the chairs in small groups, cigarettes in hand. The Vietnamese iced coffee (filter) comes at 12K and the tall glass of Vietnamese iced coffee runs for 15K. Not bad on either occasion! From what I can tell, the cafe is open throughout the afternoon. So, if you want to avoid some of the bigger crowds, come during lunchtime and have the nice, open-air cafe to yourself.

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/an-cafe.user_comment: When I first pulled up to the cafe, the first floor wasn't all too impressive. It looked like there was some construction material in the indoor parking area (yes, they have one!). Then a few wooden tables up front, but I took a glance up and noticed there was a second floor. I ascended up the narrow flight and was thoroughly impressed by how spacious and varied the seating upstairs was! On one side -- the side facing the street -- is a huge wooden floor sitting area. There are plywood low-level tables with green and blue seat cushions to sit on. The walls are adorned with comic books and a few other trinkets, and there are some big, plush stuffed animals in the center. I saw some kids come up and grab them to sit with - cute! In the center is larger seating with benches and tables and a TV front and center. It's the best lit area. And on the other end of the second floor is more personalized seating for small groups or alone. The walls are decorated with kitschy paintings and an assortment of antique-looking items. Altogether, it has a real nice feel because of its eclectic interior! The coffee ran for 14K and exactly what I wanted! An Cafe was a nice place to sit and read, and the environment made it nice and cozy to do for a few hours!

At first sight are a lot of shoes on the ground and when you look inward, all you see are low tables and square seat cushions on the floors. The shop looks small at first, but walking in bare-foot or with socks on brings you into a 3-room deep seating area. The walls are decorated with patterned wallpaper and other assortments and the ceiling has things hanging from it. The seating is intimate and close together, but it makes for a nice chat with a friend one-on-one or a lot of friends sitting around and talking. I liked sitting on the floor on the mats because it felt a lot more humble and relaxed, as well as if you were at your own home! So, the vibe is very welcoming and warm. The drinks were nice and sweet and definitely affordable for the time you spend there just hanging out. Would definitely recommend coming back and bringing friends!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/hue-bun-t.user_titlec: Super tasty bowl of grilled pork noodles!
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/hue-bun-t.user_comment: I love coming here! The place is run by a husband and wife duo with some other workers, too. I visited when it was in a smaller space last year, fitting just 10 people at most. They expanded to a bigger indoor space with lots more outdoor seating. The workers are all super friendly and quick to serve you, bringing out the food as it's ready and then a cup of nuoc che xanh to accompany the dish. But the food really gets me! The bun thit nuong runs for an affordable 15K and the bowl comes with it all: tender and juicy pieces of pork, pickled vegetables, peanuts, leafy greens, a peanut (?) sauce, chili and of coures, your rice noodles. I would definitely pay more for this bowl of noodles than 15K! But, since the price is low, I just visit more frequently to show my support. Would definitely recommend stopping by this joint on more than one occasion!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/pho-hang-.user_comment: Pho Hang serves a great bowl of pho. The broth tastes clean and refreshing -- you can tell they take a lot of care in preparing it. The broth doesn't feel greasy and heavy, but light and sweet with the right amount of "beefiness". The tai beef they serve is cooked just right and stays nice and tender while you eat, not being chewy at all. The ladies in the back make the noodles just right, too! Overall, it's a great bowl and a small one only costs you 20K. The menu, while exclusively pho, has all the assortment of meats you'd want and gives you the option of a small or large bowl, depending on your appetite for the day. I recently had a bowl of pho here after a long motorbike ride and it hit the spot. Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for something warm and tasty!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/tam-phuc-.user_titlec: Solid meal at a good price!
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/tam-phuc-.user_comment: Came here for a quick evening meal around 5 p.m. and the place was relatively busy. Most of the tables had someone or a group eating there with a few people standing at the front for take-out. If there's a good sign, it's having a lot of customers! I sat down for banh uot thit nuong and the food was served after a few minutes. The banh uot was standard but I thought the grilled pork did a good job at being well cooked, marinated well and lean so that it was easy to chew and eat! The food was affordable at 20K for a plate and would definitely recommend coming here if you're looking for a meal that does the job!

Moc Mien is a super spacious cafe with a large koi pond in the center. There is a lot of greenery around and umbrella-ed or thatch-covered seating, so the whole space feels like a little serenity from the asphalt roads of the town. On a nice sunny day, it's nice to sit back in Moc Mien and see kids running around and families come and go. Drinks are affordable and service is quick. There's a large variety of things to order and it's easy to spend a few hours here if the weather permits. Would definitely recommend this place if you want to avoid the more typical roadside cafes -- skip the dust and get a bit of fresh air!

Luckily this meal goes for 20K, serving as an affordable meal after a morning of work!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/vi-da-xua.user_titlec: Everything you want in a bowl of Mi Quang!
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/vi-da-xua.user_comment: Came here for a quick lunch and was served in a few minutes. The shop owner brought out a plate of lime and chili and it followed with my bowl of Mi Quang. The bowl came with all your regular assortment of toppings -- half an egg, crispy sesame rice paper, slow cooked pork ribs, chopped green onions and peanuts to top it all off. The noodles were of the flat and yellow variety, being cooked just right for quick consumption. The pieces of pork were tender and packed with flavor, my only ask is that there was more in a bowl! The soup, with a touch of lime, was a good way to put down the meal after you ate all of what came inside. And all of this just for 20K! I will definitely be coming back when I'm looking for a bowl of Mi Quang!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/nguoc-cof.user_titlec: Cool design idea for a cafe!
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/nguoc-cof.user_comment: Nguoc Cafe is, as its Vietnamese name suggests, upside down. You may not notice it much on the first floor ‚Äî aside from some peculiar windows ‚Äî but the second floor is where the name really shows. A creaky walk up a narrow flight of stairs leads you to a room particularly upside down and a more private, non-smoking floor seating area. The floor sitting space has maybe enough seat cushions for 15 and has a mural painted brick wall in the back. The main room has an assortment of wooden tables and chairs. A quick glance up and you'll see the same on the ceiling! The walls have upside down art and everything. The design is cute and adds to a usually vacant ceiling with something unique and creative. The Vietnamese iced coffee was 14K if I remember correctly! And pretty good! Overall, the cafe is nice with the design, affordable coffee and it is peacefully quiet (at least, they were not playing music while I was there in the early evening!). Makes for a good reading spot! Will come back!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/luna-cafe.user_comment: Luna is located on the busy road of Hung Vuong with a handful of seating for you to enjoy life passing by. The menu has a lot of options for you to indulge in, I ordering a milk tea with tapioca pearls for just 14K. The drink came out quickly and I sat down enjoying a sunny afternoon. The milk tea was just right on sweetness and came with the tapioca pearls and some jelly. It was a refreshing drink to enjoy after a day of work and lunch! The interior is welcoming, too. Blues and whites adorn the walls with some trinkets on small shelves and murals covering the walls. It has a youthful atmosphere, and I can imagine students coming here to relax after a day of school. Would recommend!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/da-cafe.user_comment: Cafe Da is like a small garden cafe. You walk in under a wooden sign with the name of the cafe painted on and have a few wooden tables and chairs to your side, but you may likely take the few stone steps over a small Koi fish pond to the "indoor" central area. It's like sitting under a gazebo, really. The "indoor" portion is mostly outdoor since the windows are likely open and windows are all encompassing the gazebo, save for the corner coffee bar area. Inside are a handful of more wooden tables and chairs. There is minimal decoration around the cafe, but you do get a quaint vibe because it is rather small and confined. The walls have different colored stones with some sculptures affixed to it. The gazebo ceiling has a very light, woody feel (probably because it seems light and woody). On a sunny day, I feel like the cafe is a relaxing getaway from the heat! I went on a rather gloomy day, but the cafe is still nice to go to. A tall cup of Vietnamese iced coffee (the other option being the filter Vietnamese iced coffee) comes at 15K and is pretty great! It's on the sweeter side, but I didn't mind. Would recommend stopping by here sometime!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/an-vat-do.user_comment:
Doi Hit Khoi is a super spacious place, being a huge first floor with a smaller second story. But, all the seating is on the floor with cute padded floor cushions and painted tires as tables. That arrangement makes the huge space even huger compared to if it was filled with traditional tables and chairs. The basically corrugated tin-box that is this snack spot serves suitable to large groups of friends coming to hang out for a drink or some quick food. The decorations are spread around, adding a nice personality to the space. Overall, the interior gets you focused on enjoying the people with your with, just helping put you in a cushy position to do so!

Unfortunately, the shop doesn't have bubble tea, but still has milk tea with jelly and other flavors. For 15K, it's not bad and there are a few other drinks to choose from! Would recommend!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/pho-tu-ha.user_titlec: Good bowl of pho for a rainy day
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/pho-tu-ha.user_comment: I came here this late afternoon for a quick bowl of pho to warm me up on a rainy day. The little family-owned shop is run out of the front of their house with the hug vat of pho sitting near the front entrance. The bowl of pho was brought out quickly with all the typical arrangements -- blanched bean sprouts, leafy greens, lime and pickled onions and garlic. The pho was pretty standard but definitely good. It's on a main road so it's an easy place to stop by if you need something quick to eat! At just 25K a bowl, I'll be coming back when I'm looking for a bowl of pho for sure!

The cafe is nicely set up with its Parisian theme with its outdoor seating and ample indoor space taking up two floors. With a lot of space, it's a nice place to bring your whole crew of friends to hang out or just be with a few of your closest friends. The coffee was a bit more pricey and tasted all right, perhaps just when I went! Regardless, if you're ordering other things on the menu you could find some gems and just enjoy being on the corner of the street with wide open windows. Day or night, the cafe is a cute place to stop by.

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/bazan-caf.user_comment: I came to Bazan on a slow Sunday afternoon, just after the typical lunch period. There was a group of friends in one corner and a pair of friends in another, while I took another corner of the cafe. The space is relatively small, with love seats packed together to form little seating areas for four with a glass table in the middle. The seats are a dull orange leather, but the interior is lit up by its huge window facing Tran Hung Dao and the Huu Nghi Hotel. Location wise, Bazan is close to a major four-way intersection, which makes it a convenient stop to grab a coffee. I had an iced black coffee, costing just 13K. The coffee was all right at best, but at least it was affordable! The place isn't the most well ventilated if there are smokers inside, there being only the front entrance and back hallway to circulate air if the fans aren't running. If you can come at a slow period of time, though, you'll be lucky to have a small space to get a lot of work done in a homey setting!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/le-bleu-c.user_comment:
Just a quick turn off the main road of Hung Vuong is this little gem of a cafe! A glance at the front is already promising -- there's a coffee bar set up with bright but soft lighting. Off to the side is a tucked away table for four with pink chairs and a dart board hanging on the wall. Another step into the cafe and you have the second room with high up chairs with a chalkboard in a background with two more seating arrangements present (a bench and then two low and padded lawn chairs). Walk past the kitchen and upstairs and you'll find the restrooms and three more seating areas -- two indoors and one balcony seating. It's all well planned out with a solid interior decorator working their magic here. Each room has its unique flair and it starts with the eclectic fixtures on the walls and across the tables to the furniture itself. Love it!

Best part is the coffee was on point. Served in a tall glass with straw, the Vietnamese iced coffee was on the sweeter side with a chocolate-y hint to it. Letting the ice melt to mellow out the condensed milk made sitting in the cafe for awhile easy. I'll definitely be back to enjoy the awfully pleasant interior and good coffee!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/net-xua-c.user_comment: I didn't think this place was a cafe at first since it has that old-school look on it, but I finally made the stop in! The more ancient Vietnamese look is a nice touch and the interior seems like one big backyard to enjoy. There are some potted plants and "marble" sculptures scattered around the cafe. The middle is nice and open, with covered seating on the left and right side, as well as in the back.The decorating follows the black-lacquered wood motif with simple carvings. Overall, you get a nice feeling being here and it seems well-equipped to handle families since there's a lot of space and big tables. The cafe also has a breakfast menu, and when I came by late Saturday morning, a handful of families were there munching on sandwiches and sipping of mixed drinks. Overall, Net Xua is a nice place to stop by and read, but the Vietnamese iced coffee (20K) was on the more expensive end -- I assume it's the premium for the design!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/duy-cafe.user_comment:
I had passed by Cafe Duy on several occasions and finally made my stop on this rainy morning. The cafe stands out with its bright orange metal grating which the namesake sign is affixed upon. With a large metal roof overhead, the inside of the cafe looks dark from the exterior, but walking in reveals it's a lot brighter than you'd think. The cafe is all cement floors with wooden and metal tables. The interior is quite the same -- black painted metal bars and columns supporting the cafe with wooden planks filling in empty space to add a pleasant aesthetic. Although decorations are minimal, there quite a few potted plants hanging around. From where I was sitting, the plants were named as coffee plants from around Southeast Asia, a Dalat and Thailand breed hanging in front of me. 

When I took a seat near the front, with an overhead light making my reading unquestionably well-lit, a staffer came immediately with tea and took my order. The iced milk coffee came in a tall glass with crushed ice and a tall plastic spoon. The coffee was all right and cost 17K. But! The major upside to possibly just a standard cup of coffee this time around is that the music wasn't too loud, the setting is unobtrusive but still easy on the eye, all making for a sweet spot to take in a good book. And that's what I've been looking for! So I'm glad to have finally stepped into this cafe and will be sure to be back!

Lim Coffee opened up recently and it's a pretty nice spot! Located on a big corner next to the Cultural Center, Lim has a good view of the center of town. I especially like how wide open the cafe is, with a sweeping second story view that is basically all open with only support columns visible. When I visited, I went up to the second floor and took a seat at their slightly elevated floor seating. They had little plywood polygon tables and red seat cushions to use. It's a nice place to have a cup of coffee and enjoy the fresh-air, especially on a sunny-but-not-too-hot day. Coffee was solid and on the cheaper end (14K for Vietnamese hot coffee) even though the space looks fancier! Will stop by again sometime!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/koi-cafe.user_comment: Cafe Koi is down a small alley next to a gym, but once you take a quick stroll you'll end up seeing a large space with ample seating. There's a nice covered area for you to sit if it's drizzling and then a wide selection of places to sit around a central pond of the cafe. There are wooden chairs and there are benches. There are wooden swing chairs and big and small tables. Basically, anything you'd really need. If you want to make your coffee occasion real private, you can walk anywhere around the pond and find a secluded space to sit away from others. Or, you can sit near the service station and enjoy the company of large groups. Kids can enjoy the space, too, because it is so wide open! The Vietnamese milk coffee ran for 14K and came with your typical glass of tea. On a cool day, Cafe Koi is a nice place to enjoy the breeze and read a good book. Would recommend visiting!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/bao-tien-.user_titlec: Great open-air cafe with plenty of seating
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/bao-tien-.user_comment: Bao Tien is not too far off from the center of town, down Hung Vuong. It is as open-air as it gets. Two complete sides of the cafe are unobstructed by nothing more than the chairs and tables for customers to sit at. There are plenty of smaller wooden chairs outside the "indoor" portion of the cafe, making for good roadside seating and watching life go by. At night, the cafe is dimly lit with warm, yellow lighting. the design is on the minimal side with few wall adornments, but the cafe gives off the more relaxed feeling, anyway. 12K got me a iced Vietnamese coffee and it wasn't bad at all! There's a lot of space for small and large groups, so if you're looking for a convenient place to go, Bao Tien should definitely be an option!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/farm-coff.user_titlec: A Vietnamese cafe at its purest!
https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/farm-coff.user_comment:
Nothing fancy here (except for maybe the two-bean coffee blend Farm Coffee signs its customers to!). Farm Coffee is your brick-and-mortar cafe with some hanging lights and a slew of low-seated wooden chairs and stools and tables that make your ass hurt. No decorations around, really, except for that big sign. Groups of men are huddled around the small tables, cigarettes in hand. And if a cig isn't in hand, you bet they're reaching for another one. There was only the quiet, static hum of news radio going on in the background from a small speaker in in the far corner of the cafe. The back was your barista stand. And the whole cafe, on this decently busy Monday evening, was being run by a single person!

As standard as the cafe seems, I think it's all you want sometimes. A solid iced coffee at 12K with your cup of tea. No loud, reverbating music playing in the background. And big open space for a lot of groups to congregate and smoke. Perfect spot to read or hangout with some of your buddies! Will come back!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/2-0-cafe.user_comment: I visited 2.0 on a rainy day, so it the cafe was relatively empty. Although the weather was dark and wet, the cafe was welcoming with its dim yellow lights and little square seating areas separated by wide open arches. Although the decorations were more sparse, the interior design was well thought out and made the cafe look like an extravagant garden with its flora and running water. 2.0 is large enough that if you went on a slow day, you could easily feel like you had the place to yourself. But I could imagine that on a weekend, the cafe would be packed and filled to the brim with people coming in out and out -- the space invites that! Whether it's a gloomy or sunny day, bring your friends and enjoy the spacious cafe!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/cafe-giai.user_comment: Kh√¥ng gian ·∫•m c√∫ng, ph√π h·ª£p cho m·ªçi l·ª©a tu·ªïi. Th·ª©c u·ªëng th·∫≠t tuy·ªát.gi√° b√¨nh d√¢n.
Cafe ƒë·∫≠m ƒë√†, gi√° c·∫£ ph√π h·ª£p. N√≥i chung th·∫≠t tuy·ªát v·ªùi.

A cafe like any other, really. But it's not a bad cafe to stop by. I came around 10 a.m., around when people go home for their afternoon break or during an early lunch. No one was around, which was fine, because it made a convenient and quiet place for me to read for a while. The coffee came out in a few minutes and I had the place to myself for the remainder of the time, exception being a customer who dipped in for 10 minutes to grab a lime soda. The cafe feels like home because it is in foyer of an actual home. Just behind the staircase is the family's living room -- TV, kitchen and kid's backpacks and shoes strewn around. Coffee was good and just 10K. Nothing special about this cafe, but also nothing that should deter you. If you're nearby and are just looking for a coffee or place to relax, come through!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/window-pl.user_comment: Window Plus is located near the center of town and is easy to get to. It's a rather spacious cafe, with two stories and extending very deep down, making for a lot of room to have private gatherings or huge ones. Coming in the evening, it's a bit dark, so sitting near the road gives better lighting and more fresh air. But, the entire cafe is basically open-air, so getting a breeze is pretty easy. The coffee was solid and comes at 12K. The interior is pretty simply designed, a central motif of the cafe seeming to be the color orange. Not a bad place to visit, but it's a bit dark to read!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/thanh-cof.user_comment: Thanh Coffee is pretty close to the center of town and easy to spot with its bright circular sign bearing its name. The cafe has a motorcycle theme to it ‚Äî tires used as decorations and small tables. Some fancier motorcycles are parked in the rear, too! Upstairs you'll find a few bike paintings and photos as well. Aside from the extra decor for theme, Thanh is your pretty solid higher end cafe in Dong Ha. It's well lit and has a lot of places to sit with a good view. Being on the corner, sitting up on the second floor against a window is a nice view out to a pretty busy street. Along with the normal seating are a few elevated floor seatung areas with cushions in the corners of the second floor! Pretty cozy to sit at with a good book. At about 7 p.m., the cafe turned on music but before then it was a quiet haven to study or read, which I enjoyed a lot! For three people and three coffees plus a deck of cards, 62K was the total. Making each coffee just under 20K. Pretty good coffee at a fair price and a nice place to boot. Will be back sometime!

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/nho-sai-g.user_comment: I stopped in Nho Sai Gon since it had "Sai Gon" in it's name -- perhaps a taste of what I'm familiar with. Of course, this is more a drinking place and the food is geared to go good with some beers. I went alone and didn't plan on drinking (and didn't). So! I just ordered a bowl of little clams (?) cooked in lemon grass and chilis. The guy attending me was friendly and answered any questions I had about the dishes, too. The bowl came out after about 10 minutes with a side of spicy dipping sauce. For 45K, the meal definitely didn't fill me up. It wasn't bad, though. With friends and some cold brews, I think this place could be a lot of fun so I would try coming by if you have company, unlike me...

https://www.foody.vn/quang-tri/ngau-nhie.user_comment: Ngau Nhien is right next to Dong Ha's movie theatre, making it a nice place to stop by before you catch a film. The cafe was a bit dimly lit in the evening, which may be good to set a mood or just dark! The Vietnamese iced coffee was 14K and nicely sweet with ample condensed milk at the bottom. Wi-Fi was solid and chairs are comfortable enough. Bathroom was a bit stodgy, but if you're in and out for a quick second, you shouldn't mind it too much! I think the best part is that it's next to the theatre, but maybe it's better in the daytime.
